articles.title: Quantum ‘echoes’ reveal the potential of Google's quantum computer
articles.author: Science News
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(74, 222, 128);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(34, 197, 94);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Quantum ‘echoes’ reveal the potential of Google's quantum computer</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Quantum Computing</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(74, 222, 128);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(34, 197, 94);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Quantum ‘echoes’ reveal the potential of Google's quantum computer</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Quantum Computing</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Quantum ‘echoes’ reveal the potential of Google's quantum computer

Researchers claim that Google's Willow quantum chip has demonstrated verifiable quantum advantage, a significant milestone in quantum computing. The chip performed a quantum calculation, measuring a phenomenon known as 'quantum echoes', 13,000 times faster than the Frontier supercomputer, one of the world's most powerful.

This task, which would take the supercomputer an estimated 150 years, was completed in just days on the Willow chip. Crucially, the result can be verified, addressing a key challenge in the field of proving the accuracy of quantum calculations.

“If I can't prove to you that the data is correct, how can I do anything with it?” — Tom O'Brien, Google Quantum AI

Data & Insights

Google's Willow quantum chip has achieved what researchers call verifiable quantum advantage. This means it has performed a calculation far beyond the reach of classical supercomputers, and the result can be confirmed as correct.

Broader Impact

This achievement is a significant step toward the first real-world applications of quantum computing. By providing verifiable results, it builds confidence in quantum systems and paves the way for their use in complex fields like drug discovery and materials science.

Key Takeaways

  • Google's Willow quantum chip has reportedly achieved verifiable quantum advantage.
  • It performed a calculation 13,000 times faster than the Frontier supercomputer.
  • The task would take a supercomputer 150 years but was done in days on the Willow chip.
  • This is a major step toward practical and trustworthy quantum computing applications.

articles.title: On this day in space: Oct. 22, 1992: Gene Roddenberry's ashes launch
articles.author: Space.com
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(30, 58, 138);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(23, 37, 84);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>On this day in space: Oct. 22, 1992: Gene Roddenberry's ashes launch</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Space History</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(30, 58, 138);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(23, 37, 84);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>On this day in space: Oct. 22, 1992: Gene Roddenberry's ashes launch</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Space History</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
On this day in space: Oct. 22, 1992: Gene Roddenberry's ashes launch

On October 22, 1992, the Space Shuttle Columbia launched on mission STS-52, carrying a unique payload: the ashes of Gene Roddenberry, the creator of 'Star Trek.' This marked one of the first instances of a space burial.

The primary mission objectives were to deploy the Laser Geodynamic Satellite II and operate the U.S. Microgravity Payload-1. Roddenberry's ashes were carried by astronaut James Wetherbee. After orbiting the Earth, the shuttle returned, and the ashes were brought back.

“To boldly go where no one has gone before.” — Star Trek

Data & Insights

Other portions of Gene Roddenberry's ashes have since been flown on other space missions, continuing his legacy of space exploration.

Broader Impact

The symbolic gesture of carrying the 'Star Trek' creator's ashes into space resonated with fans worldwide, cementing the connection between the beloved science fiction series and the real-life aspirations of space travel.

Key Takeaways

  • On Oct. 22, 1992, some of Gene Roddenberry's ashes were flown on the Space Shuttle Columbia.
  • This was part of mission STS-52, which also deployed a satellite.
  • It was one of the first instances of a space burial.
  • The ashes were returned to Earth after the mission, and other portions have flown since.

articles.title: Spacey Jane to play Fremantle Arts Centre with Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson
articles.author: PerthNow
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(251, 146, 60);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(234, 88, 12);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Spacey Jane to play Fremantle Arts Centre with Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Perth</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(251, 146, 60);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(234, 88, 12);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Spacey Jane to play Fremantle Arts Centre with Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Perth</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Spacey Jane to play Fremantle Arts Centre with Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson

Perth-based indie rock band Spacey Jane has announced two shows at the Fremantle Arts Centre on December 19 and 20. They will be supported by other Western Australian artists, Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson.

The band, which is currently on tour in the UK, last played in Fremantle in June and July, selling out seven shows. Tickets for the 'Home For The Holidays' shows will go on sale this week.

“Freoooo we're coming home. Two special nights with @stelladonnelly and @foolnelson_ at one of the greatest venues in the world, @fremantleartscentre.” — Spacey Jane

Data & Insights

Spacey Jane's upcoming 'Home For The Holidays' shows at the Fremantle Arts Centre will feature an all-WA lineup, with support from Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson. Pre-sale tickets begin on Thursday, with general sales available on Friday.

Broader Impact

The announcement highlights the vibrant local music scene in Western Australia, with three prominent WA acts coming together for two major hometown shows, demonstrating the continued popularity and drawing power of local talent.

Key Takeaways

  • Spacey Jane will play two shows at the Fremantle Arts Centre on December 19 and 20.
  • The band will be supported by fellow WA artists Stella Donnelly and Fool Nelson.
  • The band is currently on tour in the UK.
  • Tickets for the 'Home For The Holidays' shows go on sale this week.

articles.title: JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution Compilation Movie Reveals Exclusive IMAX Visual
articles.author: Daryl Harding
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(107, 114, 128);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(55, 65, 81);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution Compilation Movie Reveals Exclusive IMAX Visual</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Movies</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution Compilation Movie Reveals Exclusive IMAX Visual

An exclusive IMAX visual has been released for the upcoming compilation movie, *JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution*. The film is set to recap the anime's intense 'Shibuya Incident' arc and will also feature the first two episodes of the next arc, 'The Culling Game.'

The movie will have advance screenings in Japan on November 7, including in IMAX theaters. Toho Animation and GKIDS are bringing the film to North America on December 5, with releases in other international regions to follow.

“A recap of the intense 'Shibuya Incident' arc and a preview of 'The Culling Game' arc.” — Official Description

Data & Insights

The compilation movie serves as a bridge between major arcs of the popular anime series, offering both a summary of past events and a glimpse into the future storyline for fans.

Broader Impact

The release of a compilation movie, especially with an IMAX run, demonstrates the massive global popularity of the JUJUTSU KAISEN franchise and its importance to distributors like Toho Animation and GKIDS as a major cinematic event.

Key Takeaways

  • An exclusive IMAX visual for the *JUJUTSU KAISEN: Execution* movie has been released.
  • The film will recap the 'Shibuya Incident' and preview 'The Culling Game' arcs.
  • Advance screenings in Japan start on November 7.
  • A North American release is scheduled for December 5.

articles.title: Netflix goes 'all in' on generative AI as industry remains divided
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(220, 38, 38);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(127, 29, 29);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Netflix goes 'all in' on generative AI as industry remains divided</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Media</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(220, 38, 38);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(127, 29, 29);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Netflix goes 'all in' on generative AI as industry remains divided</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Media</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Netflix goes 'all in' on generative AI as industry remains divided

Netflix is deepening its commitment to generative AI, viewing it as a tool to improve content creation. The company recently utilized on-screen generative AI for visual effects in its Spanish-language series *The Eternaut*, a move that co-CEO Ted Sarandos stated was ten times faster than traditional methods.

In response to the growing use of AI, Netflix has also published new guidelines for its creative partners. These guidelines distinguish between low-risk and high-risk applications, emphasizing that AI should not replace union-represented jobs without proper agreements and must respect creative rights and data privacy.

“AI should not replace union-represented jobs without proper agreements and must respect creative rights and data privacy.” — Netflix AI Guidelines

Data & Insights

Netflix's use of generative AI in the series *The Eternaut* reportedly completed visual effects work ten times faster than traditional methods, showcasing the potential for significant efficiency gains in production workflows.

Broader Impact

As a major player in the entertainment industry, Netflix's embrace of generative AI and its proactive establishment of usage guidelines could set a precedent for how the technology is adopted across film and television production, balancing innovation with creative and labor rights.

Key Takeaways

  • Netflix is increasing its use of generative AI in content creation.
  • The company used AI for visual effects in the series *The Eternaut*, achieving a 10x speed increase.
  • New guidelines have been published for partners on the use of AI.
  • The guidelines emphasize protecting union jobs and creative rights.

articles.title: Veeam acquires data security company Securiti AI for $1.7B
articles.author: Taylor Soper
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(37, 99, 235);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(29, 78, 216);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Veeam acquires data security company Securiti AI for $1.7B</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Acquisitions</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(37, 99, 235);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(29, 78, 216);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Veeam acquires data security company Securiti AI for $1.7B</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Acquisitions</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Veeam acquires data security company Securiti AI for $1.7B

Data resilience provider Veeam Software is set to acquire data security posture management (DSPM) firm Securiti AI for $1.725 billion in cash and stock. The deal aims to integrate Securiti's expertise in data governance, privacy, and compliance with Veeam's data backup and recovery solutions.

This will offer enterprises a unified platform to manage, secure, and recover data, which is crucial for the safe implementation of AI systems. Following the acquisition, Securiti AI's CEO, Rehan Jalil, will join Veeam as President of Security and AI.

“We've entered a new era for data. It's no longer about just protecting data from cyber threats and unforeseen disasters; it's also about identifying all your data, ensuring it's governed and trusted to power AI transparently.” — Anand Eswaran, CEO of Veeam

Data & Insights

The acquisition, valued at $1.725 billion, will combine Veeam's data resilience leadership with Securiti AI's specialisation in Data Security Posture Management (DSPM), privacy, and governance.

Broader Impact

This major acquisition highlights the growing importance of unifying data security and data management. As more companies adopt AI, the need for a comprehensive platform that ensures data is secure, compliant, and recoverable becomes critical for mitigating risks and enabling innovation.

Key Takeaways

  • Veeam Software is acquiring Securiti AI for $1.725 billion.
  • The deal combines data resilience with data security posture management (DSPM).
  • The goal is to create a unified platform for managing and securing data for AI applications.
  • Securiti AI CEO Rehan Jalil will become Veeam's President of Security and AI.

articles.title: I spent a month living with a $430 AI pet, the Casio Moflin
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(236, 72, 153);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(190, 24, 93);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>I spent a month living with a $430 AI pet, the Casio Moflin</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Robotics</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(236, 72, 153);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(190, 24, 93);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>I spent a month living with a $430 AI pet, the Casio Moflin</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Robotics</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
I spent a month living with a $430 AI pet, the Casio Moflin

The Casio Moflin is an AI-powered pet that aims to develop an emotional bond with its owner. Covered in soft, washable fur, the Moflin is equipped with sensors that detect touch and sound, allowing it to learn and develop a unique personality over time.

Its algorithm enables it to express a range of 'emotions' through different movements and sounds. The device charges via a wireless 'nest' and is designed to evolve its behavior based on its interactions, simulating the experience of raising a real pet.

“Moflin is your smart companion; they learn and respond uniquely to their owner's interactions.” — Casio

Data & Insights

The Moflin uses an AI-powered emotional spectrum to express feelings like joy and curiosity. Its personality evolves through ongoing interaction, which can be tracked on the MofLife app across four sliders: energy, cheerfulness, shyness, and affection.

Broader Impact

AI pets like Moflin represent a growing field of emotional AI, designed to provide companionship and comfort without the responsibilities of a live animal. This technology could have applications in various settings, from busy professionals in apartments to care facilities seeking safe and low-maintenance sources of comfort.

Key Takeaways

  • The Casio Moflin is an AI pet designed to form an emotional bond with its owner.
  • It uses sensors and an algorithm to learn and develop a unique personality.
  • Moflin expresses 'emotions' through sounds and movements.
  • It is aimed at providing low-maintenance companionship and stress relief.

articles.title: Sources: Multimodal AI startup Fal AI already raised at $4B+ valuation
articles.author: Marina Temkin
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(16, 185, 129);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(5, 150, 105);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Sources: Multimodal AI startup Fal AI already raised at $4B+ valuation</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Funding</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(16, 185, 129);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(5, 150, 105);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Sources: Multimodal AI startup Fal AI already raised at $4B+ valuation</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Funding</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Sources: Multimodal AI startup Fal AI already raised at $4B+ valuation

Fal.ai, a startup providing infrastructure for developers working with image, video, and audio AI models, has reportedly secured around $250 million in a new funding round, bringing its valuation to over $4 billion.

This is a significant increase from its $1.5 billion valuation during a Series C round just three months prior. The late-stage financing was reportedly led by Kleiner Perkins and Sequoia Capital.

“The sizeable funding and sharp valuation increase clearly indicate investor confidence in the “agent” layer of AI.” — Aibase Analysis

Data & Insights

Fal.ai has seen its valuation more than double in approximately three months, rising from $1.5 billion to over $4 billion. The new funding round of around $250 million reflects intense investor interest in the AI infrastructure sector.

Broader Impact

The massive jump in Fal.ai's valuation underscores the high demand for specialized infrastructure that supports multimodal AI applications. As companies increasingly integrate AI that processes images, video, and audio, the platforms that power these models are becoming critical and highly valued components of the tech ecosystem.

Key Takeaways

  • AI infrastructure startup Fal.ai has reportedly raised about $250 million.
  • The company's valuation has surged to over $4 billion.
  • This is a significant increase from its $1.5 billion valuation three months ago.
  • The funding round was reportedly led by Kleiner Perkins and Sequoia Capital.

articles.title: a16z-backed Codi launches AI agent office manager
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(96, 165, 250);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(59, 130, 246);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>a16z-backed Codi launches AI agent office manager</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Startups</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(96, 165, 250);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(59, 130, 246);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>a16z-backed Codi launches AI agent office manager</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Startups</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
a16z-backed Codi launches AI agent office manager

Andreessen Horowitz-backed startup Codi has launched an AI-powered platform designed to automate and streamline office management. The new SaaS product aims to handle logistical tasks such as managing vendors, restocking supplies, and coordinating cleaning services.

By automating these administrative duties, Codi intends to free up office managers to focus on employee culture and strategic growth initiatives. The company, which has raised $23 million to date, is positioning its AI agent as a tool to help companies manage their return-to-office strategies more efficiently.

“By designing an AI to coordinate with actual humans—scheduling your cleaning, stocking your pantry, and managing furniture installation—we are fundamentally disrupting facilities management.” — Christelle Rohaut, CEO of Codi

Data & Insights

Codi's AI platform has already shown significant traction, booking $100,000 in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) within the first five weeks of its beta release. Early adopters report saving hundreds of administrative hours and reducing office management overhead by up to 83%.

Broader Impact

Codi's launch signals a shift towards AI-powered automation in workplace and facilities management. This technology could transform traditional office operations, making them more efficient and allowing human staff to concentrate on higher-value, people-focused roles, which is particularly relevant as companies navigate hybrid and return-to-office models.

Key Takeaways

  • Codi, backed by Andreessen Horowitz, has launched an AI platform to automate office management.
  • The platform handles tasks like vendor coordination and restocking supplies.
  • It aims to save companies administrative costs and time.
  • The beta version achieved $100,000 in ARR within five weeks.

articles.title: Comet 3I/ATLAS could shower NASA's Jupiter probe in charged particles
articles.author: Space.com
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(107, 114, 128);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(55, 65, 81);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Comet 3I/ATLAS could shower NASA's Jupiter probe in charged particles</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Comets</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Comet 3I/ATLAS could shower NASA's Jupiter probe in charged particles

NASA's Europa Clipper spacecraft is predicted to pass through the ion tail of the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, presenting a rare opportunity to directly sample material from an object outside our solar system.

According to researchers, this encounter with the comet's charged particles would be harmless to the spacecraft. The alignment provides a unique chance to analyze the composition of an interstellar comet's interior, which acts as a time capsule from its formation billions of years ago.

“This encounter...would be harmless to the spacecraft.” — Researchers

Data & Insights

The European Space Agency is also utilizing its spacecraft near Mars and Jupiter to track the comet as it moves through our solar system, contributing to a multi-point observation campaign of this interstellar visitor.

Broader Impact

Directly sampling material from an interstellar object is a landmark event in space science. It could provide unprecedented data on the composition and origin of materials from another star system, offering clues about planetary formation and the diversity of celestial bodies in our galaxy.

Key Takeaways

  • NASA's Europa Clipper may fly through the ion tail of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS.
  • This offers a rare chance to sample material from outside our solar system.
  • The encounter is predicted to be safe for the spacecraft.
  • The European Space Agency is also tracking the comet with its own probes.

articles.title: The Palace Arcade: Fremantle bar closes on High Street
articles.author: PerthNow
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(245, 158, 11);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(217, 119, 6);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>The Palace Arcade: Fremantle bar closes on High Street</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Perth</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(245, 158, 11);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(217, 119, 6);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>The Palace Arcade: Fremantle bar closes on High Street</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Perth</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
The Palace Arcade: Fremantle bar closes on High Street

The Palace Arcade in Fremantle, a popular bar known for its retro arcade games and New York-style pizza, has announced its closure after five years of operation. The decision not to renew their lease on High Street was attributed to ongoing noise complaints and the threat of significant fines, which prevented them from hosting live music events.

The business expressed gratitude to its customers and suppliers. The Palace Arcade's other locations in Northbridge and Victoria Park will remain open.

“Due to ongoing noise complaints from our neighbours and the threat of some huge fines, we've been unable to host our much-loved music events.” — The Palace Arcade

Data & Insights

The core reason for the closure was the inability to host live music, a key part of their business model, due to noise complaints. This made committing to another five-year lease on High Street unviable for the owners.

Broader Impact

The closure of a popular venue like The Palace Arcade due to noise complaints highlights the ongoing challenges of balancing a vibrant nightlife and entertainment scene with the concerns of residents and other businesses in urban centers like Fremantle.

Key Takeaways

  • The Palace Arcade in Fremantle is closing after five years.
  • The closure is due to noise complaints and fines that prevented live music events.
  • The bar's locations in Northbridge and Victoria Park will remain open.
  • The final night of operation is scheduled for October 27th.

articles.title: FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(100, 116, 139);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(51, 65, 85);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Regulation</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(100, 116, 139);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(51, 65, 85);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Regulation</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
FTC removes Lina Khan-era posts about AI risks and open source

The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has removed multiple blog posts published during Lina Khan's time as chair, which discussed the risks associated with AI and supported open-source models. This move is seen as a significant shift in the agency's regulatory approach.

The deleted posts include warnings about potential consumer harm from AI and one advocating for 'open-weight' AI models to help smaller companies compete. This action has raised questions as it appears to contradict the current administration's own AI Action Plan, which supports open models to foster innovation.

“I was stunned to see the FTC under Andrew Ferguson act so differently from the Trump White House in sending this message to the industry.” — Douglas Farrar, former FTC public affairs director

Data & Insights

Among the deleted posts were titles such as "On Open-Weights Foundation Models," "Consumers Are Voicing Concerns About AI," and "AI and the Risk of Consumer Harm." These removals are part of a wider trend, with reports of around 300 posts related to AI and tech lawsuits being taken down.

Broader Impact

The removal of these posts suggests a significant pivot in the FTC's approach to technology regulation, moving away from the more assertive stance of the Khan era. This could signal a softer oversight environment for tech companies but also raises concerns about transparency and the preservation of government records.

Key Takeaways

  • The FTC has taken down several blog posts about AI risks from Lina Khan's tenure as chair.
  • The posts discussed consumer harms and the benefits of open-source AI models.
  • The move is viewed as a major shift in the agency's regulatory stance on AI.
  • This action appears to conflict with the current administration's stated support for open models.

articles.title: Watch comets Lemmon and SWAN make closest approach to Earth live online
articles.author: Space.com
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(99, 102, 241);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(79, 70, 229);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Watch comets Lemmon and SWAN make closest approach to Earth live online</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Comets</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Watch comets Lemmon and SWAN make closest approach to Earth live online

Skywatchers have the rare opportunity to see two comets, C/2025 A4 (Lemmon) and C/2025 R2 (SWAN), as they make their closest approach to Earth. Comet Lemmon will pass by at a distance of about 56 million miles, while Comet SWAN will be even closer at roughly 24 million miles.

Both are expected to reach their peak brightness around October 20th and 21st. The Virtual Telescope Project, led by astronomer Gianluca Masi, is hosting a special livestream of the event. Comet Lemmon, discovered in January 2025, is visible in the evening sky, while Comet SWAN, discovered in September 2025, is best viewed before dawn.

“Together, these two comets will make autumn 2025 a memorable season for skywatchers.” — Jenette Scott, Salt Lake Astronomical Society

Data & Insights

Comet SWAN will make its closest approach on October 20, coming within 24 million miles of Earth. A day later, on October 21, Comet Lemmon will pass by at about 55 million miles. Both may be bright enough to be seen with the naked eye in dark skies.

Broader Impact

The simultaneous appearance of two relatively bright comets provides a unique and exciting opportunity for both amateur and professional astronomers to observe and study these icy visitors from the outer solar system, inspiring public interest in celestial events.

Key Takeaways

  • Two comets, Lemmon and SWAN, are making their closest approach to Earth in October.
  • Comet SWAN will be closer, at 24 million miles, while Lemmon will be 56 million miles away.
  • Peak brightness for both is expected around October 20-21.
  • The Virtual Telescope Project is hosting a livestream of the event.

articles.title: Starbucks Beeliar: Sneak peek of coffee chain's seventh Perth venue
articles.author: Zach Margolius
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(6, 182, 212);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(8, 145, 178);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>Starbucks Beeliar: Sneak peek of coffee chain's seventh Perth venue</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Perth</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(6, 182, 212);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(8, 145, 178);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Starbucks Beeliar: Sneak peek of coffee chain's seventh Perth venue</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Perth</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Starbucks Beeliar: Sneak peek of coffee chain's seventh Perth venue

Starbucks is continuing its expansion in Western Australia with the opening of its seventh store in the Perth suburb of Beeliar. The new venue, located near the Beeliar Village Shopping Centre, will feature a drive-thru and operate from 6 am to 8:30 pm daily.

To celebrate the grand opening, the first 200 customers will receive a free reusable Cold Cup, and there will be discounts on Frappuccinos over the weekend. This opening follows the successful launch of its first WA store in Piara Waters a year ago, with more locations planned.

“To celebrate the grand opening, Starbucks plans to reward its first wave of coffee-lovers with freebies and discounts on beloved menu items.” — PerthNow

Data & Insights

The new Beeliar store is the seventh Starbucks in Perth and will feature a drive-thru. Opening day promotions include a free reusable Cold Cup for the first 200 customers and a 50% discount on Frappuccinos during the weekend's Frappuccino Happy Hour.

Broader Impact

The steady expansion of a major international brand like Starbucks into more Perth suburbs reflects the city's growing population and consumer market, particularly in southern suburbs like Beeliar, and indicates confidence in the local retail economy.

Key Takeaways

  • Starbucks is opening its seventh Perth store in the suburb of Beeliar.
  • The new store includes a drive-thru and is located near Beeliar Village Shopping Centre.
  • Grand opening promotions include free reusable cups and discounted Frappuccinos.
  • This is part of a continued expansion for the brand in Western Australia.

articles.title: How can Europe fight back against incursions by drone aircraft?
articles.author: Matthew Powell
articles.bannerImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 1200 800' width='1200' height='800'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(59, 130, 246);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(30, 64, 175);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='48' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle'>How can Europe fight back against incursions by drone aircraft?</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.7)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='24' x='50' y='760'>Aerospace</text></svg>
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(59, 130, 246);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(30, 64, 175);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>How can Europe fight back against incursions by drone aircraft?</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Aerospace</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
How can Europe fight back against incursions by drone aircraft?

In response to increasing incursions by drones, European countries are working to develop robust defense strategies. The European Commission is accelerating plans for a 'drone wall,' a network of sensors, electronic jamming systems, and weapons intended to stretch across the continent.

This multi-layered approach also includes kinetic solutions like high-powered lasers, such as the UK's DragonFire system, and specialized missiles designed to counter drone swarms. The goal is to detect, track, and neutralize unmanned aerial vehicles without depleting more expensive air defense systems.

“The goal is to detect, track, and neutralize unmanned aerial vehicles without depleting more expensive air defense systems.” — As reported by Space.com

Data & Insights

Europe's proposed 'drone wall' will consist of a continent-wide network of sensors, electronic jammers, and various weapons systems to create a comprehensive, multi-layered defense against drone threats.

Broader Impact

The development of a continent-wide anti-drone strategy reflects a major shift in modern defense priorities. As low-cost drones become more capable and accessible, nations are forced to invest in new, cost-effective technologies and collaborative strategies to protect critical infrastructure and airspace.

Key Takeaways

  • European nations are developing multi-layered defense strategies against drone incursions.
  • A proposed 'drone wall' will include sensors, jammers, and weapons across the continent.
  • Kinetic solutions like high-powered lasers and specialized missiles are also part of the strategy.
  • The aim is to create a cost-effective way to counter the growing threat of unmanned aerial vehicles.

articles.title: Where the ridge meets the river photo of the day for Oct. 16, 2025
articles.author: Kenna Hughes-Castleberry
articles.thumbnailImage: data:image/svg+xml;utf8,<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 400 300' width='400' height='300'><defs><linearGradient id='grad1' x1='0%' y1='0%' x2='100%' y2='100%'><stop offset='0%' style='stop-color:rgb(107, 114, 128);stop-opacity:1' /><stop offset='100%' style='stop-color:rgb(55, 65, 81);stop-opacity:1' /></linearGradient></defs><rect width='100%' height='100%' fill='url(%23grad1)'/><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.9)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='20' x='50%' y='50%' dominant-baseline='middle' text-anchor='middle' style='text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px black;'>Where the ridge meets the river photo of the day for Oct. 16, 2025</text><text fill='rgba(255,255,255,0.6)' font-family='sans-serif' font-size='14' x='10' y='285'>Earth Observation</text></svg>
articles.fullContent:
Where the ridge meets the river photo of the day for Oct. 16, 2025

An image captured by the OLI-2 instrument on the Landsat 9 satellite shows the Mazartagh Ridge in the Tarim Basin in western China. The photograph, taken from 438 miles above Earth, highlights the geological intersection of the desert ridge and waterways formed by glacial meltwater.

The ridge stands about 600 feet above the sands of the Takla Makan Desert, one of the world's driest, acting as a natural barrier to wind. The image reveals the deep connection between the region's landscape, climate, and history.

“The image reveals the deep connection between the region's landscape, climate, and history.” — As reported by Space.com

Data & Insights

The satellite image was captured by the Operational Land Imager 2 (OLI-2) aboard Landsat 9 from an altitude of 438 miles, showing the Mazartagh Ridge which rises 600 feet above the Takla Makan Desert floor.

Broader Impact

Satellite imagery like this provides valuable data for geologists, climatologists, and historians, offering a macro-level perspective on how landscapes are formed and how natural features influence regional climate and human history over vast timescales.

Key Takeaways

  • A Landsat 9 satellite image captures the Mazartagh Ridge in China's Tarim Basin.
  • The photo shows the intersection of the desert ridge and rivers from glacial meltwater.
  • The ridge stands 600 feet above the Takla Makan Desert.
  • The image provides insights into the region's geology, climate, and history.
